the sides were ok and incredibly salty .

while the $ 20 entree range is not overly expensive , in new york city , there is definitely better food in that range , and so sapphire , despite it 's lovely atmosphere , will most likely not be a restaurant to which i will return .
one should not go to lucky strike for the food .

besides having the table we had been promised given to other restaurant patrons twice before we were actually seated , we were served dishes we had n't ordered three times , received one of our orders 20 minutes after the rest of the table had been served ( and that order was undercooked ) , and charged $ 45 more than we should have been on our bill .
i ordered the smoked salmon and roe appetizer and it was off flavor .
we could n't carry our conversation as we were routinely interrupted by waitress and servants asking us to order and hinting that we 're taking too much time -- amazing , we just sat down .
and the tom kha soup was pathetic .
i was here a few weeks back and we had the worst customer service experience at a restaurant ever .
the bruscetta is a bit soggy , but the salads were fresh , included a nice mix of greens ( not iceberg ) all dishes are served piping hot from the kitchen .
unfortunately , the food was not something to get worked up about .

the food was undercooked-the sauce watery , and the vegetables raw .

delicious simple food in nice outdoor atmosphere .

the bar is very well stocked with interesting beers and well priced wines .

the staff was accomodating , the food was absolutely delicious and the place is lovely .
it 's a great place to pick up a cheap lunch or dinner .

they have it all -- great price , food , and service .
the atmosphere is unheralded , the service impecible , and the food magnificant .

great food ( spinach and corn dumplings and massamman curry ) , very friendly and no nonsense service and a clean and funky bathroom .

from the complimentary chef app of a delicate butternut squash ravioli in a delicious truffle sauce to an amazing buttery and tender langostine entree to a dessert that i ca n't remember because of the fabulous cakebread cabernet we were drinking -- the whole evening was amazing .
get the soup and a nosh ( pastrami sandwich ) for $ 8 and you 're golden .

the food , served in small tasting portions ( as an option ) is very good with each dish being better than the next .
i stumbled upon this second floor walk-up two fridays ago when i was with two friends in town from l.a. being serious sushi lovers , we sat at the sushi bar to be closer to the action .
$ 160 for 2 filets , 2 sides , an appetizer and drinks .
the menu is prix fixe , so be prepared to spend at least $ 60 per person , but it is well worth itsuperb food .
there is also very limited seating and there can be a substantial wait in getting food at peak times .
with the exception of our lemon salad that had so much pepper on it that our eyes started watering , the food here was decent , not great .
their bagels are fine , but they are a little overcooked , and not really a ' special ' bagel experience .
the location and ambience is ok but the food is what makes up for it .
we could only get through an appetizer and cheese fondue .
the soup for the udon was soy sauce and water .
after dinner , take your date to the huge dance floor , probably one of the biggest you 'll see in ny .
the highlight of the night was the mayonaisse for my side of fries i received from one of the food runners , which is not good considering the bill was nearly $ 100 .
the service was impeccable and unobtrusive -- the staff knows what they are there to do -- to know their menu , present your meal , and attend to your needs .
